alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 11:18AM CDT until April 16 at 2:12AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Shannon. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1118 AM CDT, gauge reports indicated previous heavy rainfall. - This includes the following low water crossings... Thomas Hollow at Highway H, Sycamore Creek at Highway H, Carr Creek at Highway HH, Mahans Creek at County Road 501 and Rocky Creek at Highway NN. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winona, Birch Tree, Eminence, Montier, West Eminence and Alley Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
